intro: Mendoncia antioquiensis, commonly known as the Antioquian mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Antioquia, Colombia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows at elevations between 1,200 and 2,500 meters above sea level, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, highlighting the need for protective measures.
